LogicVersionsRegistryInterface","name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"author":"develop@teller.finance","details":"The platform settings functions (create, update, and remove) don't include the whenNotPaused() modifier because we might need to use them in both cases (when the platform is paused and not paused). Example: - There is a potential issue and before analyzing it, we pause the platform to avoid funds losses. Finally, as result of the analysis, we decided to update a platform setting (or create a new one for the cloud nodes). In this scenario, if the modifier is present, we couldn't update the setting (because the platform is paused).","methods":{"addAuthorizedAddress(address)":{"params":{"addressToAdd":"The wallet address of the user being authorized"}},"createAssetSettings(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"assetAddress":"asset address used to create the new setting.","cTokenAddress":"cToken address used to configure the asset setting.","maxLoanAmount":"the max loan amount used to configure the asset setting."}},"createPlatformSetting(bytes32,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"maxValue":"the max value for the setting.","minValue":"the min value for the setting.","settingName":"setting name to create.","value":"the initial value for the given setting name."}},"exceedsMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"amount to test.","assetAddress":"asset address to test the setting."},"return":"true if amount exceeds current max loan amout. Otherwise it returns false."},"getAssetSettings(address)":{"params":{"assetAddress":"asset address used to get the current settings."},"return":"the current asset settings."},"getAssets()":{"return":"the asset addresses list."},"getCTokenAddress(address)":{"params":{"assetAddress":"token address."},"return":"the cToken address for a given asset address."},"getPlatformSetting(bytes32)":{"params":{"settingName":"to get."},"return":"the current platform setting."},"getPlatformSettingValue(bytes32)":{"params":{"settingName":"to get."},"return":"the current platform setting value."},"hasAuthorization(address)":{"params":{"account":"The account address to check for"},"return":"True if account has authorization, false if it does not"},"hasPlatformSetting(bytes32)":{"params":{"settingName":"setting name to test."},"return":"true if the setting is already configured. Otherwise it returns false."},"initialize(address)":{"details":"Initializes the contract in unpaused state. Assigns the Pauser role to the deployer."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address)":{"params":{"atmSettingsAddress":"the initial ATM settings address.","cethTokenAddress":"compound CETH token address.","chainlinkAggregatorAddress":"the initial pair aggregator registry address.","escrowFactoryAddress":"the initial escrow factory address.","interestValidatorAddress":"the initial interest validator address.","marketsStateAddress":"the initial markets state address.","versionsRegistryAddress":"the initial versions registry address.","wethTokenAddress":"canonical WETH token address."}},"initialized()":{"return":"true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false."},"isPaused()":{"return":"true if platform is paused. devdoc.author: develop@teller.finance
devdoc.details: The platform settings functions (create, update, and remove) don't include the whenNotPaused() modifier because we might need to use them in both cases (when the platform is paused and not paused). Example: - There is a potential issue and before analyzing it, we pause the platform to avoid funds losses. Finally, as result of the analysis, we decided to update a platform setting (or create a new one for the cloud nodes). In this scenario, if the modifier is present, we couldn't update the setting (because the platform is paused).

params.addressToAdd: The wallet address of the user being authorized

params.assetAddress: asset address used to create the new setting.
params.cTokenAddress: cToken address used to configure the asset setting.
params.maxLoanAmount: the max loan amount used to configure the asset setting.

params.maxValue: the max value for the setting.
params.minValue: the min value for the setting.
params.value: the initial value for the given setting name.

params.assetAddress: asset address to test the setting.

exceedsMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256).return: true if amount exceeds current max loan amout. Otherwise it returns false.

params.assetAddress: asset address used to get the current settings.

getCTokenAddress(address).return: the cToken address for a given asset address.

params.account: The account address to check for

hasAuthorization(address).return: True if account has authorization, false if it does not

hasPlatformSetting(bytes32).return: true if the setting is already configured. Otherwise it returns false.

initialize(address).details: Initializes the contract in unpaused state. Assigns the Pauser role to the deployer.

params.chainlinkAggregatorAddress: the initial pair aggregator registry address.

initialized().return: true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false.

isPaused().return: true if platform is paused. Otherwise it returns false.

isPlatformRestricted().return: bool True if the platform is restricted, false if not

pause().details: Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.assetAddress: asset address used to remove the asset settings.

params.addressToRemove: The wallet address of the user being unauthorized

requireAuthorization(address).details: Checks if an account address has authorization or proxy contract is registered.

params.restriction: Bool turning the resitriction on or off

settings().details: This address should NOT change over the time. See details in the _setSettings(...) function.

unpause().details: Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state.

params.newCTokenAddress: the new cToken address to configure.

params.newMaxLoanAmount: the new maximum loan amount to configure.

addAuthorizedAddress(address).notice: Adds a wallet address to the list of authorized wallets

createAssetSettings(address,address,uint.notice: It creates a new asset settings in the platform.

createPlatformSetting(bytes32,uint256,ui.notice: It creates a new platform setting given a setting name, value, min and max values.

exceedsMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256).notice: Tests whether amount exceeds the current maximum loan amount for a specific asset settings.

getAssetSettings(address).notice: Get the current asset settings for a given asset address.

getAssets().notice: Gets the current asset addresses list.

getCTokenAddress(address).notice: Gets the cToken address for a given asset address.

getPlatformSetting(bytes32).notice: It gets the current platform setting for a given setting name

getPlatformSettingValue(bytes32).notice: It gets the current platform setting value for a given setting name

hasAuthorization(address).notice: Tests whether an account has authorization

hasPlatformSetting(bytes32).notice: It tests whether a setting name is already configured.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: It initializes this settings contract instance.

initialized().notice: Gets if the contract is initialized.

isPaused().notice: It gets whether the platform is paused or not.

isPlatformRestricted().notice: Returns whether the platform is restricted or not

pauseLendingPool(address).notice: It pauses a specific lending pool.

removeAssetSettings(address).notice: It removes all the asset settings for a specific asset address.

removeAuthorizedAddress(address).notice: Removes a wallet address from the list of authorized wallets

removePlatformSetting(bytes32).notice: Removes a current platform setting given a setting name.

requireAuthorization(address).notice: Requires an account to have platform authorization.

requirePauserRole(address).notice: Requires an account to have the pauser role.

restrictPlatform(bool).notice: Restricts the use of the Teller protocol to authorized wallet addresses only

settings().notice: The gets the settings contract address from the SETTINGS_SLOT.

unpauseLendingPool(address).notice: It unpauses a specific lending pool.

updateCTokenAddress(address,address).notice: It updates the cToken address for a specific asset address.

updateMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256).notice: It updates the maximum loan amount for a specific asset address.

updatePlatformSetting(bytes32,uint256).notice: It updates an existent platform setting given a setting name.It only allows to update the value (not the min or max values).In case you need to update the min or max values, you need to remove it, and create it again.

userdoc.notice: This contract manages the configuration of the platform.
